items.name: NODEMANAGER_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: NodeManager Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: container_executor_allowed_system_users
items.description: List of users explicitly whitelisted to be allowed to run containers. Users with IDs lower than the "Minimum User Id" setting may be whitelisted by using this setting.

items.name: container_executor_banned_users
items.description: List of users banned from running containers.

items.name: container_executor_group
items.description: The system group that owns the container-executor binary. This does not need to be changed unless the ownership of the binary is explicitly changed.

items.name: container_executor_min_user_id
items.description: The minimum Linux user ID allowed.  Used to prevent other super users.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: hadoop_metrics2_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hadoop Metrics2 Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for Hadoop Metrics2. Properties will be inserted into hadoop-metrics2.properties.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: linux_container_executor_cgroups_hierarchy
items.description: Path (rooted in the cgroups hierarchy on the machine) where to place YARN-managed cgroups.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: NodeManager Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_event_whitelist
items.displayName: Rules to Extract Events from Log Files
items.description:
This file contains the rules that govern how log messages are turned into events by the custom log4j appender that this role loads. It is in JSON format, and is composed of a list of rules. Every log message is evaluated against each of these rules in turn to decide whether or not to send an event for that message. If a log message matches multiple rules, the first matching rule is used.

Each rule has some or all of the following fields:

  • alert - whether or not events generated from this rule should be promoted to alerts. A value of "true" will cause alerts to be generated. If not specified, the default is "false".
  • rate (mandatory) - the maximum number of log messages matching this rule that can be sent as events every minute. If more than rate matching log messages are received in a single minute, the extra messages are ignored. If rate is less than 0, the number of messages per minute is unlimited.
  • periodminutes - the number of minutes during which the publisher will only publish rate events or fewer. If not specified, the default is one minute
  • threshold - apply this rule only to messages with this log4j severity level or above. An example is "WARN" for warning level messages or higher.
  • content - match only those messages for which contents match this regular expression.
  • exceptiontype - match only those messages that are part of an exception message. The exception type must match this regular expression.

Example:

  • {"alert": false, "rate": 10, "exceptiontype": "java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException"}
    This rule sends events to Cloudera Manager for every StringIndexOutOfBoundsException, up to a maximum of 10 every minute.
  • {"alert": false, "rate": 1, "periodminutes": 1, "exceptiontype": ".*"}, {"alert": true, "rate": 1, "periodminutes": 1, "threshold":"ERROR"}
    In this example, an event generated may not be promoted to alert if an exception is in the ERROR log message, because the first rule with alert = false will match.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for NodeManager logs

items.name: mapred_healthchecker_script_args
items.description: Comma-separated list of arguments which are to be passed to node health script when it is being launched.

items.name: mapred_healthchecker_script_path
items.description: Absolute path to the script which is periodically run by the node health monitoring service to determine if the node is healthy or not. If the value of this key is empty or the file does not exist in the location configured here, the node health monitoring service is not started.

items.name: mapreduce_aux_service
items.description: If enabled, adds 'org.apache.hadoop.mapred.ShuffleHandler' to the NodeManager auxiliary services.  This is required for MapReduce applications.

items.name: mapreduce_shuffle_max_connections
items.description: Maximum allowed connections for the shuffle. Set to 0 (zero) to indicate no limit on the number of connections.

items.name: mapreduce_shuffle_max_threads
items.description: Maximum allowed threads for serving shuffle connections. Set to zero to indicate the default of 2 times the number of available processors.

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for NodeManager logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: max_log_size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for NodeManager logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: node_manager_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of NodeManager in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: node_manager_java_opts
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags, PermGen, or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: node_manager_log_dir
items.description: Directory where NodeManager will place its log files.

items.name: nodemanager_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: NodeManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for yarn-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only. A string to be inserted into yarn-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: nodemanager_connectivity_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health check that verifies the NodeManager is connected to the ResourceManager.

items.name: nodemanager_connectivity_tolerance_seconds
items.description: The amount of time to wait for the NodeManager to fully start up and connect to the ResourceManager before enforcing the connectivity check.

items.name: nodemanager_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: nodemanager_gc_duration_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for the weighted average time spent in Java garbage collection. Specified as a percentage of elapsed wall clock time.

items.name: nodemanager_gc_duration_window
items.description: The period to review when computing the moving average of garbage collection time.

items.name: nodemanager_health_checker_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health check that verifies the NodeManager is seen as healthy by the ResourceManager.

items.name: nodemanager_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall NodeManager health, consider the host's health.

items.name: nodemanager_local_data_directories_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Local Directories Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's NodeManager Local Directories.

items.name: nodemanager_local_data_directories_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Local Directories Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's NodeManager Local Directories. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a NodeManager Local Directories Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: nodemanager_log_directories_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Container Log Directories Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's NodeManager Container Log Directories.

items.name: nodemanager_log_directories_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Container Log Directories Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's NodeManager Container Log Directories. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a NodeManager Container Log Directories Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: nodemanager_mapred_safety_valve
items.displayName: NodeManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for mapred-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only. A string to be inserted into mapred-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: nodemanager_recovery_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Recovery Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's NodeManager Recovery Directory.

items.name: nodemanager_recovery_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Recovery Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's NodeManager Recovery Directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a NodeManager Recovery Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: nodemanager_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the NodeManager's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: nodemanager_web_metric_collection_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Cloudera Manager Agent can successfully contact and gather metrics from the web server.

items.name: nodemanager_web_metric_collection_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the duration of the metrics request to the web server.

items.name: nodemanager_webserver_https_port
items.description: The HTTPS port of the NodeManager web application.

items.name: nodemanager_webserver_port
items.description: The HTTP Port of the NodeManager web application.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled
items.displayName: Dump Heap When Out of Memory
items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: process_should_monitor
items.description: Cloudera Manager agent monitors each service and each of its role by publishing metrics to the Cloudera Manager Service Monitor. Setting it to false will stop Cloudera Manager agent from publishing any metric for corresponding service/roles. This is usually helpful for services that generate large amount of metrics which Service Monitor is not able to process.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: role_health_suppression_node_manager_audit_health
items.displayName: Suppress Health Test: Audit Pipeline Test
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Audit Pipeline Test heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_node_manager_connectivity
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the ResourceManager Connectivity heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the File Descriptors heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON-formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger is not evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here can lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases.

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_address
items.description: The address of the NodeManager IPC.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_admin_env
items.description: Environment variables that should be forwarded from the NodeManager's environment to the container's.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_container_manager_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads container manager uses.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_delete_debug_delay_sec
items.description: Number of seconds after an application finishes before the NodeManager's DeletionService will delete the application's localized file and log directory. To diagnose YARN application problems, set this property's value large enough (for example, to 600 = 10 minutes) to permit examination of these directories.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_delete_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads used in cleanup.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_disk_health_checker_interval_ms
items.description: Frequency, in milliseconds, of running disk health checker.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_disk_health_checker_max_disk_utilization_per_disk_percentage
items.displayName: Dish Health Checker Max Disk Utilization Percent
items.description: The maximum percentage of disk space utilization allowed after which a disk is marked as bad. Values can range from 0.0 to 100.0. If the value is greater than or equal to 100, the NodeManager will check for full disk. This applies to local directories and log directories.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_disk_health_checker_min_free_space_per_disk_mb
items.displayName: Disk Health Checker Minimum Health Disk Space
items.description: The minimum space that must be available on a disk for it to be used. This applies to local directories and log directories.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_disk_health_checker_min_healthy_disks
items.displayName: Disk Health Checker Minimum Health Disks Fraction
items.description: The minimum fraction of number of disks to be healthy for the NodeManager to launch new containers. This correspond to both local directories and log directories; that is, if there are fewer healthy local directories (or log directories) available, then new containers will not be launched on this node.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_env_whitelist
items.description: Environment variables that containers may override rather than use NodeManager's default.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_heartbeat_interval_ms
items.description: Heartbeat interval to ResourceManager

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_linux_container_executor_cgroups_strict_resource_usage
items.description: CGroups allows cpu usage limits to be hard or soft. When this setting is true, containers cannot use more CPU usage than allocated even if spare CPU is available. This ensures that containers can only use CPU that they were allocated. When set to false, containers can use spare CPU if available. It should be noted that irrespective of whether set to true or false, at no time can the combined CPU usage of all containers exceed the value specified in Containers CPU Limit Percentage.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_local_dirs
items.description: List of directories on the local filesystem where a NodeManager stores intermediate data files.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_address
items.description: Address where the localizer IPC is.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_cache_cleanup_interval_ms
items.description: Address where the localizer IPC is.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_cache_target_size_mb
items.description: Target size of localizer cache in MB, per local directory.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_client_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads to handle localization requests.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_fetch_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads to use for localization fetching.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_log_dirs
items.description: List of directories on the local filesystem where a NodeManager stores container log files.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_log_retain_seconds
items.description: Time in seconds to retain user logs. Only applicable if log aggregation is disabled.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_recovery_dir
items.description: The local filesystem directory in which the NodeManager stores state when recovery is enabled. Recovery is enabled by default.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_remote_app_log_dir
items.description: HDFS directory where application logs are stored when an application completes.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_remote_app_log_dir_suffix
items.description: The remote log dir will be created at {yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir}/${user}/{thisParam}

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_resource_cpu_vcores
items.description: Number of virtual CPU cores that can be allocated for containers. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_resource_memory_mb
items.description: Amount of physical memory, in MiB, that can be allocated for containers.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_resource_percentage_physical_cpu_limit
items.description: Amount of CPU reserved for all the containers on each node.
